reviewText: I still remember the first time I saw this movie... I thought I was going to bust a gut I laughed so hard! There are a lot of talented actors in this film who were just getting started when this film came out (the Wayans brothers leap to mind), not to mention some veteran actors from the sixties and seventies. Anyone who sees this film always remember some scene clearer than the rest and the case my wife (whom I met years later) it was the scene where "Cherry" made her confession... and the famous line "Don't make me hop after you!"I give this my highest rating!
Title: N/A

reviewText: "I'm Gonna Git You Sucka!", the first and best Wayans film, is a wonderful mix of 70's blaxploitation, honesty, and pure camp. It is difficult to conceive of the number of jokes used in this film, from the skinny white, mustached stuntman filling in for a middle aged black woman to Chris Rock's craving for "a rib". The social commentary by Keenen Ivory Wayans far outdoes his later films, but the performances here really shine. A truly spectacular comedy.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The best way to sum up this film is by saying that this is one of the funniest movies I have seen. This film ranks right up there with Airplane and Blazing Saddles. And by that I mean that after watching this film you will find yourself quoting lines from this film for years to come. I first saw this film over 15 years ago and to this day I still find it hilarious. Even though I have seen it many times and I know all the jokes I still laugh at them. This film is that funny. This is the Wayans Bros. back when they first got started and were at there best. This film is a parody of every blaxploitation film ever made. And it is funny picking out refernces to the different films. Also keep an eye out for cameos from various actors. And always pay attention to things that are happening in the background. 15+ years later and I am still finding things happening in the background that I missed before. So order this film sit back and be prepared to laugh so hard that you cry.
summary: How did he go to the bathroom with all that stuff on???

reviewText: Before "Scary Movie" and their hit-television series "In Living Color" the Wayans' family starred and produced this hysterical send-up of the "blaxploitation" films of the 1970's Starring Keenan Ivory Wayans, Damon Wayans, Kim Wayans and a talented cast of some of television's  most popular African-American stars, "I'm Gonna Git You Sucka" takes place in the inner.Returning home for the funeral of his brother (he died of an "O.G." ,  an overdose of wearing too many gold chains), Jack Spade (Keenan Ivory Wayans) discovered that a crime boss, Mr. Big,  is running the ghetto using fear and intimidation. His mother (Janet DuBois of television's "Good Times"), his brother's widow (Dawn Wells of television's "A Different World") and others fear for his life, but he goes on deciding to end  Mr. Big's reign of terror and crime.Loaded with gags, jokes, and many hysterical scenes especially Dawn Wells' "PMS rage scene", "I'm Gonna Git You Sucka" for anyone who enjoys spoofs. Keep an eye out for comedian Chris Rock in one of his first film appearances as the "rib guy" (he appears twice in the film: once during the regular run, and the other at the very end of the credits). This film is a  comedic classic that paved the way for the Wayans to takeover Hollywood with their unique style of humor and wackiness. If you loved "Scary Movie," then you'll love this film.
summary: Humorous Spoof by a Comic Family
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'M GONNA GIT YOU SUCKA is one hilarious film; even though many of the jokes fall flat at times, the whole is superlative tongue in cheek satire.  A broad humored satire of those wonderful 70's "black exploitation" films, Wayans and crew serve up scene after scene of hilarity.  For instance:  a sleazy girl is singing a sultry version of "When the Saints Come Marching In," and when Wayans asks who she is, the waitress says "She's the director's sister."  (She is!).  When ex-football star Jim Brown asks Wayans why he thinks he's qualified to be a black hero, Wayans tells him "I'm an ex football player."  When Dawnn Lewis as Wayans' sweetie gets the cramps, she really gets cranky!!  John Vernon as Mr. Big spouts off why shouldn't he be in a black exploitation movie, other actors have!  There are so many scenes like this that one can't help but laugh and laugh again.Featuring a cavalcade of black and white actors, including Clarence Williams III, Isaac Hayes, Ja'net Dubois, Antonio Fargas and Steve James, I'M GONNA GIT YOU SUCKA is a hoot to watch!

reviewText: Back when spoof movies were actually funny, there was this clever spoof of blaxploitation movies called Im Gonna Git You Sucka. At the time the Wayans brothers were starting to emerge on the scene and this movie was their best work(Dont Be A Menace comes in second). The whole movie was Jack(played by Keenan Ivory Wayans)returns home from the service to find out that his brother passed on. He finds out that his brother worked for Mr. Big and sets out to deal with him and his cronies with the help on Jack Slade and crew others. There are too many funny scenes in this movie but the girl at the club(played by the gorgeous Anne Marie Johnson) removing her hair, leg, and butt was the funniest scene in the movie.  Jack's mom(played by Janet Du'bois of Good Times) beating up on Mr Big's goons comes in second. Damon Wayons and Kadeem Hardison were hilarious too as Mr. Big's bumbling henchmen. I think Antonio Fargas's Fly Guy coming out of jail wearing fishbowls in his platform shoes was a riot too. And the scene where Richard Roundtree's character had the swollen bunions.....classic! Im Gonna Git You Sucka came out at a time when you can expect a good spoof and today stands out as one of the funniest spoofs in parody movie history. If you're looking for a good spoof you cant go wrong with this one. Two thumbs WAY up.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This film does have some very funny moments like the rib joke but I felt a wee bit let down that the script and story line was not as good as it could have been. It nice to see the old boys back (Hayes,Brown etc...) but where were Pam Grier, Fred Williamson and Richard Roundtree !!....now that would have been excellent. I love Blaxploitation but I wish this was better.
summary: I love Blaxploitation...but this was ok

reviewText: I have a specific rule for purchasing movies.  If I want to just watch it, I'll get it via one of the streaming services or Netflix.  If it's something I know I'll watch multiple times, I'll buy it, especially when it's around $10.The movie may be fairly uneven, it has some really good, funny scenes, mixed with quite a lot of long stretches of weird (and boring) plot points.  But overall it's a great job by the Wayun's.

reviewText: One of the funniest I've ever seen. One of the funniest movies of the 80's. But the DVD quality is horrible. Since its not an anamorphic transfer the quality is grainy. The DVD only has 3 gigs of data so that means the movie was compressed. You would think a greatly written and acted movie would have a commentary and extras features. Not on this!! This movie deserved better treatment.
summary: Great Movie but disappointing DVD package

reviewText: I'M GONNA GIT YOU SUCKA! is a spoof an blaxploitation films of the 1970's. This is the first film written, directed by, and starring Keenen Ivory Wayans. Jack Spade is an Army secretary who returns home to find out that his brother has died of an O.G. (an overdose of gold chains). Jack gathers up an army of some local neighborhood hero's (Bernie Casey, Antonio Fargas, Steve James, Isaac Hayes, and Jim Brown) to help him fight and defeat Mr. Big, the crime lord responsible for his brother's death. This movie has many funny moments, especially one that has Chris Rock making an appearance as a rib joint customer. This is a film for both action and comedy fans! Keenen Ivory Wayans would go on to direct SCARY MOVIE and SCARY MOVIE 2!
